sen.j: 平松家（ひらまつけ）は平氏平氏高棟王流で、西洞院時慶（従二位・参議）（1552年 - 1640年）の次男平松時庸（ときつね）（従二位・中納言）（1599年 - 1654年）を祖とする堂上家。
sen.e: The Hiramatsu family is the lineage of the Prince Takamune of the Taira clan and Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) founded by Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Chunagon (middle counselor) in Junii (Junior Second Rank)) (1599-1654), the second son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) in Junii) (1552-1640).

The Hiramatsu family, drawn lineage of the Prince Takamune of the Taira clan, was a Tosho-ke (family of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) founded by Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Chunagon (middle counselor), Junii (Junior Second Rank)) (1599-1654), the second son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor),Junii (Juinior Second Rank) (1552-1640).
sen.cmt: Cut down on explanation fo Tosho-ke for clarity.
sen.e: Belonged to the lineage of the Prince Takamune of the Taira clan, the Hiramatsu was a family of dojo kuge (nobles occupying relatively high ranks) of which the founder was Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) of Junii (Junior Second Rank)) (1599-1654), the second son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) of Junii (Junior Second Rank)) (1552-1640).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Chunagon (middle counselor)→Chunagon (vice-councilor of state)に変更しました。

sen.j: 後水尾天皇の側近だった西洞院時直（従二位・参議）（1584年 - 1636年）は長兄、長谷家の祖長谷忠康（正三位・民部省）（1612年 - 1669年）及び交野家の祖交野時貞（大膳職）は弟に当たる。
sen.e: Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Sangi in Junii) (1584-1636) who was a close retainer of the Emperor Gomizuo was his elder brother, Tadayasu NAGATANI (Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) in Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)) (1612-1669), the founder of the Hase family, and Tokisada KATANO (Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table)), the founder of the Katano family were his younger brothers.

Tokistune's brothers were: Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Sangi, Junii (Junior Second Rank) (1584-1636) who was a close retainer of the Emperor Gomizuo was (elder brother); Tadayasu NAGATANI (Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs), Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)) (1612-1669), the founder of the Hase family (younger brother); and Tokisada KATANO (Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table)), the founder of the Katano family (younger brother).

Tokitsune's brothers were: Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Sangi, Junii) (1584-1636) who was a close retainer of the Emperor Gomizuno (eldest brother); Tadayasu NAGATANI (Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs), Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)) (1612-1669), the founder of the Nagatani family (younger brother); and Tokisada KATANO (Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table)), the founder of the Katano family (younger brother).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 家格は名家 (公家)、江戸時代後期の平松時章（1754年 - 1828年）が正二位・大納言に上った以外、歴代当主の極官は正二位・中納言である。
sen.e: The social standing was Meika, upper rank of Kuge, and the kyokkan (the most highest rank which one was appointed) of the successive head was Chunagon in Shonii (Senior Second Rank) except Tokiakira HIRAMATSU (1754-1828) who was assigned to Dainagon (Major Counselor) in Shonii in the latter part of the Edo period.

The social standing of the family was Meika, upper rank of Kuge, and, aside from Tokiakira HIRAMATSU (1754-1828) who became Dainagon (Major Counselor), Shonii (Senior Second Rank), in the latter part of the Edo period, the highest office held by the hereditary family heads was Chunagon (middle counseler), Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

The social standing of the family was Meika, upper rank of Kuge, and, aside from Tokiakira HIRAMATSU (1754-1828) who became Dainagon (chief councilor of state) of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in the latter part of the Edo period, the highest office held by the hereditary family heads was Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Dainagon (Major Counselor)→Dainagon (chief councilor of state)に変更しました。Chunagon (middle counselor)→Chunagon (vice-councilor of state)に変更しました。

sen.j: 平松時方（従二位・中納言）（1651年 - 1710年）は、野宮定基らと並び有職故実に詳しく「有職四天王」の一人に数えられる。
sen.e: Tokikata HIRAMATSU (Chunagon in Junii) (1651-1710) knew much about Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) and was one of the Yusoku-shitenno (the four specialists of the ancient practices) as well as Sadamoto NONOMIYA and others.

Tokikata HIRAMATSU (Chunagon in Junii) (1651-1710) knew much about Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) and was one of the Yusoku-shitenno (the four specialists of the ancient practices) along with Sadamoto NONOMIYA.
sen.cmt: Removed and others. It is clear from the context that there were others.
sen.e: Tokikata HIRAMATSU (Chunagon of Junii) (1651-1710) had a profound knowledge of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) and was counted among the 'Yusoku-shitenno' (the four specialists of the ancient practices) along with Sadamoto NONOMIYA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 更に議奏になるものも出た。
sen.e: In addition, there was a person who put in charge of giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor).
Another member of the Hiramatsu family became giso (a position charnged with conveying what congress decides to the emperor).
Some member of the Hiramatsu family was appointed to a position of Giso (in charge of conveying the congress decisions to the emperor).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: そして平松家からは石井家が分かれ出た。
sen.e: And the Ishii family was split from the Hiramatsu family.
The Hiramatsu family aslo produced a branch family called the Ishii.
The Hiramatsu family had a branch family called the Ishii.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.e: Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo period was 200 goku crop yields.
Their hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 200 koku of rice.
Their hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 200 koku of rice.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争の際にはその戦功により賞典禄50石が与えられた。
sen.e: At the time of Boshin Civil War, it was given 50 goku as Shotenroku (premium) by its contribution to the war.
At the time of Boshin Civil War, they were awarded a further 50 goku as Shotenroku for their contribution to the war.
In the Boshin Civil War, their contributions were rewarded with Shotenroku (additional rice stipends) of 50 goku.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.e: It was assigned to viscount after the Meiji period.
From the Meiji period onwards, the family held the title of viscount.
From the Meiji period onwards, the title of viscount was bestowed on the family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。
